sections.title: What is Attack Surface Discovery?
sections.content: Attack Surface Discovery provides comprehensive visibility into all assets in your environment, including devices, internet-facing assets, accounts, applications, cloud resources, and APIs. This helps you understand your organization's exposure to potential threats.

sections.title: Key Tasks
items: Configure data sources to discover assets automatically
Review device risk scores and prioritize remediation
Monitor internet-facing assets for vulnerabilities
Export device inventory for compliance reporting
Set up alerts for new high-risk assets

sections.title: Admin Tips
sections.content: As an administrator, focus on configuring data sources and ensuring complete asset coverage. Regular reviews of the data source status panel help maintain accurate discovery.

sections.title: What is Attack Surface Discovery?
sections.content: Attack Surface Discovery helps you identify and assess all assets in your environment. As a security analyst, you'll use this to investigate potential vulnerabilities and prioritize threat response.

sections.title: Analyst Workflow
items: Review high-risk devices and investigate vulnerabilities
Analyze internet-facing assets for exposure
Track changes in your attack surface over time
Correlate asset data with threat intelligence
Generate reports for incident investigation

sections.title: Investigation Tips
sections.content: Focus on the risk score trends and newly discovered assets. Use the device details to understand the security posture of each asset and prioritize your investigation efforts.

sections.title: What is Workbench?
sections.content: Workbench is your central hub for threat detection and incident response. It aggregates alerts from multiple sources and uses AI to correlate events into actionable insights.

sections.title: Key Tasks
items: Configure alert sources and detection rules
Manage user assignments and escalation workflows
Set up automated response playbooks
Monitor SLA compliance and team performance
Export alerts for compliance and reporting

sections.title: What is Workbench?
sections.content: Workbench is where you investigate and respond to security alerts. It provides AI-powered insights to help you quickly understand and triage threats.

sections.title: Investigation Workflow
items: Review and triage incoming alerts by severity
Investigate alert details and correlated events
Take response actions (isolate, block, collect evidence)
Document findings and close resolved alerts
Escalate complex incidents to senior analysts

sections.title: Investigation Tips
sections.content: Use the AI-powered insights to understand the attack timeline. Check the correlation graph to see related events and identify the full scope of an incident.

sections.title: What is Endpoint Inventory?
sections.content: Endpoint Inventory provides a comprehensive view of all endpoints in your environment, including workstations, servers, and mobile devices. Use it to manage security policies, track compliance, and monitor endpoint health.

sections.title: Key Tasks
items: Configure endpoint sensors and agents
Assign security policies to endpoint groups
Monitor agent status and connectivity
Review compliance violations and remediate
Manage endpoint lifecycle (onboarding/offboarding)

sections.title: What is Endpoint Inventory?
sections.content: Endpoint Inventory shows all endpoints in your environment. As an analyst, you'll use this to investigate compromised devices, check security status, and take response actions.

sections.title: Investigation Tasks
items: Search for specific endpoints by name, IP, or user
Review endpoint risk scores and vulnerabilities
Check installed software and running processes
Isolate compromised endpoints from the network
Collect forensic evidence from suspicious devices

sections.title: Executive Overview
sections.content: Attack Surface Discovery provides visibility into your organization's security exposure. Use this dashboard to understand risk trends, asset coverage, and areas requiring investment.

sections.title: Key Metrics
items: Monitor overall risk index and trends
Review asset coverage across business units
Track internet-facing asset exposure
Assess compliance with security policies
Generate executive reports for board meetings

sections.title: About This View
sections.content: This dashboard shows discovered assets and their security status. You have read-only access to view reports and export data.

sections.title: Available Actions
items: View asset inventory and statistics
Export reports in various formats
Filter and search for specific assets
View risk scores and trends

devices-tab.title: Devices Tab
devices-tab.content: View all discovered devices including workstations, servers, and network equipment. Each device shows its risk score, operating system, and last seen timestamp.

internet-facing-tab.title: Internet-Facing Assets
internet-facing-tab.content: Monitor assets exposed to the internet including web servers, APIs, and cloud services. These assets require special attention as they are directly accessible to potential attackers.

accounts-tab.title: Accounts
accounts-tab.content: Track user accounts across your environment. Identify privileged accounts, inactive accounts, and accounts with weak security configurations.

risk-index.title: Risk Index
risk-index.content: The Risk Index is a calculated score (0-100) representing your organization's overall security posture. Higher scores indicate greater risk exposure. It's calculated based on device vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, and threat intelligence.

total-devices.title: Total Devices
total-devices.content: The total number of devices discovered in your environment. This includes all endpoints, servers, network devices, and IoT devices detected by configured data sources.

data-sources.title: Data Sources
data-sources.content: Data sources are integrations that automatically discover and inventory assets. Common sources include Active Directory, cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), vulnerability scanners, and network discovery tools.

alerts-tab.title: Alerts
alerts-tab.content: Security alerts generated by detection rules and threat intelligence. Each alert represents a potential security incident requiring investigation.

investigations-tab.title: Investigations
investigations-tab.content: Active security investigations combining multiple related alerts. Investigations help you understand the full scope of an attack campaign.

severity-filter.title: Severity Filter
severity-filter.content: Filter alerts by severity: Critical (immediate action required), High (investigate within 24h), Medium (investigate within 1 week), Low (review as time permits).

status-filter.title: Status Filter
status-filter.content: Filter by investigation status: New (unassigned), In Progress (actively investigating), Resolved (threat mitigated), False Positive (benign activity).

correlation-graph.title: Correlation Graph
correlation-graph.content: Visual representation of related security events. Shows how alerts are connected through common indicators like IP addresses, users, or files.

endpoints-tab.title: Endpoints
endpoints-tab.content: All managed endpoints including workstations, laptops, and mobile devices. Shows agent status, security policy compliance, and last check-in time.

servers-tab.title: Servers
servers-tab.content: Server inventory including physical servers, virtual machines, and containers. Monitor patch status, running services, and security configurations.

agent-status.title: Agent Status
agent-status.content: Shows the health of security agents: Online (connected and reporting), Offline (not reporting for >24h), Outdated (agent version needs update).

policy-compliance.title: Policy Compliance
policy-compliance.content: Percentage of endpoints meeting security policy requirements. Policies define required security controls like antivirus, firewall, encryption, and patch levels.

isolation-action.title: Network Isolation
isolation-action.content: Isolate a compromised endpoint from the network to prevent lateral movement. The endpoint can still communicate with the management server for remediation.
